game_description: Tetris Effect: Connected adds an all-new robust multiplayer expansion to the huge variety of addictive and innovative single-player modes that Tetris Effect is known for with all-new co-op and competitive online and local multiplayer modes. Now with cross-platform play and Spectator Mode! Tetris Effect: Connected is Tetris¬Æ like you've never seen it, or heard it, or felt it before‚Äîan incredibly addictive, unique, and breathtakingly gorgeous reinvention of one of the most popular puzzle games of all time, from the people who brought you the award-winning Rez Infinite and legendary puzzle game Lumines. Music, backgrounds, sounds, special effects‚Äîeverything, down to the Tetris pieces themselves, pulse, dance, shimmer, and explode in perfect sync with how you're playing, making any of the game's 30+ stages and 10+ modes something you'll want to experience over and over again.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), Chinese (Hong Kong), Chinese (Taiwan), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Spanish (Spain)
Developer: Monstars Inc., Resonair and Stage Games
review_1: I‚Äôm so happy I paid $30 for this app long ago and I am proud to say I finally passed the ritual level that was war tremendously hard for me because I didn‚Äôt expect for it to speed up I got a D but I‚Äôll take it it‚Äôs been so long but I got it done.
review_2: Words cannot express how much I love this new Tetris Effect! I love the music I love the lyrics I love how I'm making the music also while I change the layout of the piece.. the effects are incredible! I almost bugged out when I unlocked the level that turns the whole tetris board upside down! Or make the pieces super gigantic! Even some boards the tetris pieces are totally different looking and shaped...its soooo much I can hardly describe! I'm in the daily challenges those boards are super cool and incorporate mediation and relaxation. I almost cried it's super wonderful for me! 5 stars all the way! I loved the movie too! I've always been playing tetris since Gameboy when I was a teen..im 45 now.

review_4: What else is there to say besides "it is Tetris"? Well, in my opinion, the game is devoid of any real meaningful personality. Best way to describe this game is as filler content, like a b rated movie, something you just do to pass time. I guess it's kinda cool that as you get higher in lines completed the music increases in complexity. But other than that, it's just a basic a$$ Tetris. And functionally and in design, there's no reason for this to be in VR as there's nothing about it that actually takes advantage of the fact. It might as well be a flat screen. Honestly, if you wanted to play this version of Tetris, you might as well play it elsewhere as you wouldn't have to deal with any of the uncomfortableness that comes with VR like the weight on your head and the eye adjustment when you come back to the real world, etc. Speaking of the real world, why is there no option to play Tetris in AR? That would have been an interesting experience for 2 minutes, to play Tetris in the real world. But no. It's Tetris. Nothing good or bad about it. Nothing defining at all. It's just a budget quality Tetris
